abstract_summ: Clinical, laboratory and imaging characteristics of Coronavirus disease 2019 (Covid-19) and risk factors associated with poor outcomes have been reported in various studies.1-2 Nevertheless, information on whether other respiratory pathogens (RP) were co-detected in patients in these series was not provided, despite the fact that coinfections with RP have been reported to occur in this clinical setting.3-6 This article is protected by copyright.However, little studies have focused on clinical characteristics of discharged patients with severe COVID-19, especially the duration of viral shedding.The present coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic is affecting pregnant patients worldwide.Our objective is to summarize the basic initial respiratory support interventions recommended for pregnant patients with infection with the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).• More than 25% of patients with COVID-19 were asymptomatic.• Irrespective of clinical manifestations, all patients with COVID-19 showed prolonged viral shedding.
title_summ: A special case of COVID-19 with long duration of viral shedding for 49 daysThe duration of viral shedding of discharged patients with severe COVID-19Early Acute Respiratory Support for Pregnant Patients With Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) InfectionAsymptomatic infection and atypical manifestations of COVID-19: comparison of viral shedding durationCo-detection of respiratory pathogens in patients hospitalized with Coronavirus viral disease-2019 pneumonia.
title_abstract_phrases: Our objective is to summarize the basic initial respiratory support interventions recommended for pregnant patients with infection with the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).Asymptomatic infection and atypical manifestations of COVID-19: comparison of viral shedding duration• More than 25% of patients with COVID-19 were asymptomatic.However, little studies have focused on clinical characteristics of discharged patients with severe COVID-19, especially the duration of viral shedding.Early Acute Respiratory Support for Pregnant Patients With Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) InfectionThe present coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic is affecting pregnant patients worldwide.Our findings might shed light on the management of COVID-19.The duration of viral shedding of discharged patients with severe COVID-19The 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) has drawn global intensive attention(1-3).Clinical, laboratory and imaging characteristics of Coronavirus disease 2019 (Covid-19) and risk factors associated with poor outcomes have been reported in various studies.1-2 Nevertheless, information on whether other respiratory pathogens (RP) were co-detected in patients in these series was not provided, despite the fact that coinfections with RP have been reported to occur in this clinical setting.3-6 This article is protected by copyright.
